newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ shares end firmer, FCL Forest gains after sale.
newsitem.headline: NZ shares end firmer, FCL Forest gains after sale.

text.p: * New Zealand share prices ended firmer
* Fletcher Forest gains after sale of Forestry Corp
* Natural Gas at year high after result
Price movements at close
LAST CHG
141 nil * NZSE-40 cap index +7.97 at 2,175.76
317 + 2 * NZSC cap index +5.81 at 4,368.56
373 + 1 * Volume NZ$30 million. Futures +8 at 1,112
674 + 6 * Other movers - +4 +50

New Zealand share prices ended firmer on Wednesday after a moderate session, with Fletcher Forest enjoying a modest re-rating after Tuesday's news that it been successful in its bid for Forestry Corp of NZ.
The NZSE-40 Capital Index ended 7.97 points higher at 2,175.76 on turnover of around NZ$30 million.
Fletcher Forest ended four cents higher at NZ$1.86 while Brierley Investments, its partner in the consortium buying Forestry Corp, gained one to $1.42.
BIL is also expected to soon stage a partial withdrawal from its majority ownership of British hotels giant Thistle.
Yield-sensitive stock Telecom gained six cents to $6.74 after a mild rally in the bond market.
Fisher and Paykel was steady on NZ$4.71 but Campbell Johnstone at Hendry Hay McIntosh said decision by discount retailer The Warehouse to sell AEG appliances may have a negative impact on F&P.
There was weakness in Wilson and Horton before its first half result, expected on Thursday, the publisher falling eight cents to NZ$9.30.
Analysts expect a net profit of NZ$21-22 million.

Property stocks have been quite strong, particularly St Lukes and Kiwi Income. "Maybe there are some investors who are looking to get themselves into interest rate-sensitive stocks, those two and Telecom," Johnstone said.
Natural Gas Corp, which earlier reported a solid improvement in annual profit to NZ$28.0 million from $22.2 million, gained five cents to a high of NZ$2.90 but on light volume.
